OO: 3 characteristics of OO: OO: 2 aspects of polymorphism
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
code or operations or objects behave differently in different contexts

1. object of derived class can be treated as base class

2. virtual methods of base class can be overriden

OO: 3 characteristics of OO:
Prob: find a mother vertex in directed graph
(all vertices can be reached from)
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
1. find last completely processed vertex in DFS (pseudo toposort)

2. check if it is a mother vertex


topo sort doesn't exist on cyclic graphs

OO: 3 characteristics of OO: Prob: print number of paths with no cycle between two nodes in a directed graph
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
backtracking

set/unset visited nodes

OO: 3 characteristics of OO: Prob: from undirected graph which is a tree, find a root of a tree which gives minimum height
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
BFS from the leaves to the inside

one or two remaining nodes

O(n)

OO: 3 characteristics of OO:
Prob: check if two nodes are on same path in a tree
in O(1) per query
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
preprocessing: DFS record enter/exit times

check times for (u, v) to see if same subtree

OO: 3 characteristics of OO: Prob: weighted job scheduling (2)
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
1. sort jobs by finish time
DP weightWithJobsUntil[i]
include or exclude current job

O(n^2) / or O(n log n) with BS to find previous nonconflicting job

2. sort by start time, then DP like LIS

OO: 3 characteristics of OO: Prob: number of paths from src to dest with k edges (2)
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
1. DP numPaths[src][dest][edges]
O(k V^3)

2. Divide and Conquer matrix power G^k
O(log k) matrix power
total: O(V^3 log k)

OO: 3 characteristics of OO: Prob: minimum insertions to make string a palindrome (2)
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
1. windowed DP minIns[i][j] for substring(i, j)
O(n^2)

2. LCS with reverse string
answer: len(s) - lcs
O(n^2)

OO: 3 characteristics of OO: Prob: longest palindromic subsequence (2)
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
1. windowed DP
dp[i][j]: s[i..j], O(n^2)

2. LCS with reverse string
O(n^2)

OO: 3 characteristics of OO:
SD DS: SSTable
def, internals, read, write
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
sorted immutable on disk
- Index (in-memory): PK (ex. B-Tree)
- Data 64KB block: k/v pairs
optimised for reads
written once, no in-place changes

OO: 3 characteristics of OO:
SD DS: LSM: MemTable and SSTable
stored where, read/writes, maintenance
inheritance<br>encapsulation<br>polymorp:
MemTable in memory
SSTable on disk (except idx)
writes go to MemTable
reads go to MemTable first

periodically:
- MemTable flushed to SSTable
- SSTables merged
